result.execSummary:
The defendant Diondrell M Hale 653790 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Diondrell M Hale 653790 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Diondrell M Hale 653790 was found guilty of 1st Degree Reckless Injury, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

AODA Evaluation and Compy
Full time employment and/or schooling
no contact withthe victim, T.L. or his family or residence

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Diondrell M Hale in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Diondrell M Hale in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes no deletions, additions or corrections to the PSI.  Attorney Sheets makes some corrections to the PSI and states them on the record.   Attorney makes is recommendation and plays a video with his statment.  Exhibit 1, video.  Attorney Sheets makes his recommendation.  Court sentences the defendant.
Sentencing hearing on March 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Diondrell M Hale in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Diondrell M Hale in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on January 27, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Diondrell M Hale in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Diondrell M Hale in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties agree that the case will be set for a plea hearing.  Attorney Grode will keep his subpoenas active.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 31, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Final pre-trial on January 17, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Addendum
and Witness List (Plaintiff)
Jury trial - 12 person on October 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Diondrell M Hale in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Diondrell M Hale in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Detective Nathan Reblin is sworn and questioned by Attorney Grode. Testifies to being called to a local bar regarding a gunshot wound.   Testifies to speaking with the victim who identified the defendant as the person who shot him.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to reviewing video and observing the defendant entering the bar and the defendant and victim physically fighting.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant regarding the incident. Cross-examination by Attorney Sheets.  Questions witness regarding the location of the gun.  Questions witness regarding the specifics of the incident.  Re-direct by Attorney Grode.  Re-cross by Attorney Sheets. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell alcohol.
No contact with T.L. or residence.  No contact with Big Al's Bar.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 7, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No contact with T.L. or Big Al's Bar.
2:08 Defendant Diondrell M Hale in court, in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Transferred to Branch 1 for preliminary hearing.
